buttons.title: Get WF Same Chan Rx Gain 1

command.description-summary: Command chain/sequence as implemented in UT software style Send Settings and PAC, without pulse shaping and duration controls.
description-detail: 2. (TODO - This one takes a while to execute) Set Tx Gain (Pulse Voltage, if implemented on the hardware, typically ignored by the firmware if not implemented on the hardware)
7. Pulse and Acquire Cmd (called with arg1 = 0 to P+Aq from the RAM-stored settings just sent to the device)
8. Get current DMA waveforms (the P+Aq command is sent with arguments that only cause the capture, not the sending of the resulting WF)

buttons.description: Pulse and Acquire setting the Tx and Rx channels, and the Tx and Rx gains, oh and Rx delay too

buttons.title: EEPROM Write Sample Values

command.description-summary: Write samples values to 1st 3 EEPROM locations
description-detail: 1. Set 1st value in EEPROM to CC
2. Set 2nd value in EEPROM to CB
3. Set 3rd value in EEPROM to CA

buttons.description: Write samples values to EEPROM

buttons.title: EEPROM (re)Write to Blank/Default Values

command.description-summary: Write default cleared values back to 1st 3 EEPROM locations
description-detail: 1. Set 1st value in EEPROM to CC
2. Set 2nd value in EEPROM to CB
3. Set 3rd value in EEPROM to CA

buttons.description: Re-Write samples values back to default in EEPROM

buttons.title: Read EEPROM Values
buttons.description: Read all EEPROM Values

buttons.title: Initialize DMM
buttons.description: Select ADMM First! arg2 = (E2SACRMS = 0x07) | (BRIDGE_BIT = 0x80) | (ATTEN_BIT = 0x40)

buttons.title: Do ADC Cmd: SELFOCAL
buttons.description: arg2 is the command SELFOCAL (self offset calibration)

buttons.title: Do ADC Cmd: SYSOCAL
buttons.description: arg2 is the command SYSOCAL (system offset calibration)

buttons.title: Do ADC Cmd: SYSGCAL
buttons.description: arg2 is the command SYSGCAL (system gain calibration)

buttons.title: ADMM: All Relays Off
buttons.description: ADMM accessory command: De-energize all relays

buttons.title: ADMM: VDC: N-E (Unatten/Std)
buttons.description: ADMM accessory command: Get the potential reading (voltage, Volts DC) from North-to-East, i.e. Reference Electrode to Structure

buttons.title: ADMM: VDC: N-E (Attenuated)
buttons.description: ADMM accessory command: Get the potential reading (voltage, Volts DC) from North-to-East, i.e. Reference Electrode to Structure

buttons.title: ADMM: VDC: N-S (Unatten/Std)
buttons.description: ADMM accessory command: Get the potential reading (voltage, Volts DC) from North-to-South, i.e. Reference Electrode to Unprotected Coupon

buttons.title: ADMM: VDC: N-S (Attenuated)
buttons.description: ADMM accessory command: Get the potential reading (voltage, Volts DC) from North-to-South, i.e. Reference Electrode to Unprotected Coupon

buttons.title: ADMM: VDC: N-W (Unatten/Std)
buttons.description: ADMM accessory command: Get the potential reading (voltage, Volts DC) from North-to-West, i.e. Reference Electrode to Protected Coupon (with Bridge On, this should be the same as Ref-to-Struct)

buttons.title: ADMM: VDC: N-W (Attenuated)
buttons.description: ADMM accessory command: Get the potential reading (voltage, Volts DC) from North-to-West, i.e. Reference Electrode to Protected Coupon (with Bridge On, this should be the same as Ref-to-Struct)

buttons.title: ADMM: IDC (DC Current): E-S (N/A:Atten; Active Bridge Relay to Open Bridge)
buttons.description: ADMM accessory command: Get the DC current reading from East-to-South, i.e. Structure to Unprotected Coupon

buttons.title: ADMM: IAC-RMS (AC RMS Current): E-S (N/A:Atten; Active Bridge Relay to Open Bridge)
buttons.description: ADMM accessory command: Get the DC current reading from East-to-South, i.e. Structure to Unprotected Coupon

buttons.title: Example Button Title
buttons.description: Goes to the title property of the button, which appears in tooltip text usually
